newsitem.title: USA: U.S. says it has no proof Iran involved in bombing.
newsitem.headline: U.S. says it has no proof Iran involved in bombing.

text.p: The United States said the evidence was "incomplete" that Iranian officials were involved in the bombing of a U.S. military compound in Saudi Arabia last year, U.S. Defence Secretary William Cohen said on Sunday.
"So far, the evidence is incomplete," Cohen said on NBC television's "Meet the Press" programme.
"There is no conclusive evidence so far," he said.
The Washington Post, as well as an Iranian opposition group, claimed that Iranian leaders were involved in the truck bombing that killed 19 U.S. servicemen in Dharan, Saudi Arabia, last June 25.
Asked if the United States would take action against Iran, Cohen said, "If we did confirm it, we have an array of options."

The Post quoted U.S. and Saudi officials as saying Brig. Ahmad Sherifi, a senior Iranian intelligence officer, met two years before the blast with Hani Abd Rahim Sayegh, a Saudi Shiite who was arrested in Canada last month as "a direct participant" in the bombing. Iran has denied this.

"This is not the first time that America embarks on telling lies about the Islamic Republic of Iran," the Iranian News Agency IRNA quoted Maj. Gen. Mohsen Rezaei, Commander of Iran's Revolutionary Guards, as saying on Saturday.
